cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, drop_first=True)

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df[features].fillna(X_train['Age'].median()))

# Train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Handle missing values
X_train = train_df[features].copy()
X_test = test_df[features].copy()

X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Define numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Create preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ])

# Create pipeline
pipeline = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor), ('classifier', LogisticRegression(max_iter=200))])

# Fit and transform training data
X_train_processed = pipeline.fit_transform(X_train)

# Transform test data
X_test_processed = pipeline.transform(X_test)

# Train logistic regression model
model = pipeline.named_steps['classifier']
model.fit(X_train_processed, train_df[target])

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_processed)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Handle missing values
X_train = train_df[features].copy()
X_test = test_df[features].copy()

X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Define numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Create preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ])

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, train_df[target], test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Fit preprocessing on training data and transform both training and validation sets
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

# Initialize and train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_processed, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_processed)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Handle missing values
X_train = train_df[features].copy()
X_test = test_df[features].copy()

X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Define numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Create preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ])

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, train_df[target], test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Fit preprocessing on training data and transform both training and validation sets
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

# Initialize and train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_processed, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_processed)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred.astype(int)
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Handle missing values
X_train = train_df[features].copy()
X_test = test_df[features].copy()

X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Define numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Create preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ])

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, train_df[target], test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Fit preprocessing on training data and transform both training and validation sets
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

# Initialize and train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_processed, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_processed)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred.astype(int)
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
target = 'Survived'

# Handle missing values
X_train = train_df[features].copy()
X_test = test_df[features].copy()

X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)
X_test['Embarked'].fillna('S', inplace=True)

# Define numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = ['Pclass', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare']
categorical_features = ['Sex', 'Embarked']

# Create preprocessing steps
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numerical_features),
        ('cat', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'), categorical_features)
    ])

# Split data into training and validation sets
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, train_df[target], test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Fit preprocessing on training data and transform both training and validation sets
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

# Initialize and train logistic regression model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_processed, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_processed)

# Save predictions
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_pred.astype(int)
})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

ENDOFFILE
